title: Welcome
text: The Oldham Lab in the Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine Division and the Department of Medicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Harvard Medical School studies how metabolic reprogramming in cells contributes to lung disease. We are particularly interested in the pathobiology of pulmonary hypertension and pulmonary fibrosis, studying in vitro and in vivo model systems with state-of-the-art analytical techniques, including metabolomics, stable isotope tracing, extracellular flux analyses, systems biology, and network medicine. Our motivating hypothesis is that defining how cell metabolism changes in lung disease will identify new targets for drug development.

title: William Oldham
text: Will is an Assistant Professor of Medicine and Associate Physician. His research interests include pulmonary arterial hypertension, cell metabolism, adaptation to hypoxia, and network medicine. He is also the Scientific Director of the BWH Seahorse Core facility.
